Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Fuzzy \Fuzz"y\, a. [See {Fuzz}, n.] 1. Not firmly woven; that ravels. [Written also {fozy}.] [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]
2. Furnished with fuzz; having fuzz; like fuzz; as, the fuzzy skin of a peach. [1913 Webster]

fuzzy adj 1: covering with fine light hairs; "his head fuzzed like a dandelion gone to seed" [syn: {fuzzed}] 2: indistinct or hazy in outline; "a landscape of blurred outlines"; "the trees were just blurry shapes" [syn: {bleary}, {blurred}, {blurry}, {foggy}, {hazy}, {muzzy}] 3: confused and not coherent; not clearly thought out; "a vague and fuzzy idea of the world of finance" [also: {fuzziest}, {fuzzier}]
